lexUnit.name: fragile.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: easily broken, shattered, or damaged

sentence.text: Law and order seemed fragile when opposed to the growing danger of the huge new slums whose populations were feared as classes dangereuses .
Yet many Americans sense that the recovery is fragile .
Socially and economically these areas are fragile , with low family incomes and a high degree of self-provisioning .
In addition , some of the paper is fragile and in need of conservation .
Personal computers are too fragile to cope with viruses and must be replaced with sophisticated systems which are resilient to viruses in the first place .
Sick dogs often have very poor blood pressure and their veins may be fragile , which may also create difficulties .
He sat with his elbows on the huge empty desk , hands clasped at the level of his chin , the cigarette looking fragile between his laced fingers .
It made Callaghan seem untypically fragile and lacking in confidence .
The bones of the face are fragile , the eyes prominent , the hair thin and wispy .
The woman 's fragile face broke into a smile .
Nancy Harrison has to take life one step at a time â€¦ after she found she has osteoporosis , a disease which weakens the skeleton and causes fragile bones .
She caught hold of Lili 's fragile wrist .
It focused his mind on the future and about the world that his small and fragile son would one day inherit .
Sixteen SAS and SBS members and four men of the LRDG managed to squeeze on board with the fragile canoe wedged between them .
More often the problem is to limit the list of recipients , for it can be a costly business sending out fragile pottery or expensive jewellery .
On occasions offices may require pupils to use copies , especially of popular or fragile material .
Feeling the fragile shell of the golden ball -- more delicate , even , than an egg -- he was suddenly plunged back into his dream .
He fixed the fragile blossoms in a buttonhole of his braided uniform , then leaned down and kissed the woman .
The fragile canoe did not capsize !
But the only thing there was a fragile gecko , which clung splay-footed to the wall and watched me with cloudy eyes .
The flask is guaranteed unbreakable and contains absolutely no fragile glass .
More importantly , damage to the fragile environment of the Scottish hills would be reduced by the same 50% .

Environmentalists contend that the effects on the fragile forest habitat could be disastrous , with numerous rare species of plants and amphibians unique to the area being pushed close to extinction .
Unconditional surrender was more than his fragile ego could bear .
Even one of those items would have put a heavy stress on a new , fragile relationship .
The revolution deterred visitors to Madeira and adversely affected the already fragile economy .
Her fragile sanity crept away from the edge to cower inside the fortress of her orders .
The Croatian war destroyed the fragile balance in Bosnia .
Enjoy the fragile illusion of freedom while you can , but remember -- I 'm on your trail .
His temper , held so carefully in check around Sandra 's fragile emotions , exploded .
Industrial organizations are amongst the most fragile in the world .
In a nuclear world the sensible aim is a less fragile , more stable nuclear balance at the lowest level of armaments on all sides .
Seated , she appeared smaller than usual , and more fragile .
He told the man it was very old , but the gold work was too fragile to be reworked and the stones were n't worth anything .
Taking no chances , the doctor sent Lisa for X-rays -- they showed that her neck was extremely fragile .
The existence of two rival regimes will create instability in an already very fragile legal framework .
The baby , a girl , three months premature and perilously fragile , died four days later .

Thus the introduction of many cash crops , particularly peanuts , coffee , cotton and maize into ecologically fragile areas has had disastrous effects ( and some of these are analysed in Chapters 8 and 9 ) .
Yes , she should look as regally fragile as Mary .
She was one of those deceptively fragile girls who look plumper naked than clothed : she had beautiful breasts .
Rohan drew up a chair with gilded legs which looked altogether too fragile for his tall frame .
